pageContext.claim: “It's unbelievable, and yet they want wind. And wind also, is very -- it's very hard to store the electricity from wind. So if you go home and you want to watch television because President Trump is on, and you want to watch one of his very brilliant State of the Union address. If the wind isn't blowing, the husband looks as the wife says, ‘Darling, I'm sorry you can't watch tonight, the wind is not blowing.’”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often imagines that if there is no wind, then homes lose electricity. That's ridiculous. Wind turbines do not generate power when there's no wind, but the power grid can handle this variability.
